page.title: 18THE WOOL TRADE
page.content: The old wool trade has left a mark on the area. It was a time when the local area had some wealth and this has been reflected in the buildings. The old timbered cottages are the commomest buildings out of the towns. They are much sought after but often only for second homes. The church at Kersey has also benefited from the wool trade. Like many of the local churches the fabric and style of the building shows that the local merchants and farmers have given generously to the church. The local stone is flint yet this church has had the money to import limestone to give the walls support. The large population put pressure on the local agriculture and the enclosure movement was well advanced by Tudor times, this can be seen in the number of spread out farms, often containing the word "Tye".
